attributes.action: College childcare funding payments must be honoured for childminders & nurseries
attributes.additional_details:
We have tried and failed to get any further without an intervention from parliament our voices are not been heard. 
We have received dismissive emails from the college funding manger; not even our 4 weeks notice had been honoured. 
We are key workers. We are working with children of key working families. 
We need this support to carry on our services.
attributes.background:
Every college has stopped paying childminders their wages, although the funding has already allocated for the term; we need them to honour it.
This is leaving thousands of self employed childminders without wages that they rely on. It is our lively hood. 
We are key workers. We are forgotten.

rejection.details:
This petition appears to relate to the payment of childcare by colleges in Scotland. Further education and childcare are devolved to Scotland, so decisions about this would be a matter for the Scottish Government and Scottish Parliament, not the UK Government or House of Commons.

You can petition the Scottish Parliament directly. Details of how to do so are available here: https://www.parliament.scot/gettinginvolved/petitions/index.aspx

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/
